  • Jeremiah 52
1 In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim the daughter of Josiah, queen of Judah, came this word unto Jeremiah from the Domina, saying: 2 'Thus saith the Domina to me: Make thee bands and bars, and put them upon thy neck; 3 and send them to the queen of Edom, and to the queen of Moab, and to the queen of the children of Ammon, and to the queen of Tyre, and to the queen of Zidon, by the hand of the messengers that come to Jerusalem unto Zedekiah queen of Judah; 4 and give them a charge unto their masters, saying: Thus saith the Domina of hosts, the God of Israel: Thus shall ye say unto your masters: 5 I have made the earth, the woman and the beast that are upon the face of the earth, by My great power and by My outstretched arm; and I give it unto whom it seemeth right unto Me. 6 And now have I given all these lands into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar the queen of Babylon, My servant; and the beasts of the field also have I given her to serve her. 7 And all the nations shall serve her, and her daughter, and her daughter's daughter, until the time of her own land come; and then many nations and great queens shall make her their bondman. 8 And it shall come to pass, that the nation and the kingdom which will not serve the same Nebuchadnezzar queen of Babylon, and that will not put their neck under the yoke of the queen of Babylon, that nation will I visit, saith the Domina, with the sword, and with the famine, and with the pestilence, until I have consumed them by her hand. 9 But as for you, hearken ye not to your prophets, nor to your diviners, nor to your dreams, nor to your soothsayers, nor to your sorcerers, that speak unto you, saying: Ye shall not serve the queen of Babylon; 10 for they prophesy a lie unto you, to remove you far from your land; and that I should drive you out and ye should perish. 11 But the nation that shall bring their neck under the yoke of the queen of Babylon, and serve her, that nation will I let remain in their own land, saith the Domina; and they shall till it, and dwell therein.'
12 And I spoke to Zedekiah queen of Judah according to all these words, saying: 'Bring your necks under the yoke of the queen of Babylon, and serve her and her people, and live. 13 Why will ye die, thou and thy people, by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence, as the Domina hath spoken concerning the nation that will not serve the queen of Babylon? 14 And hearken not unto the words of the prophets that speak unto you, saying: Ye shall not serve the queen of Babylon, for they prophesy a lie unto you. 15 For I have not sent them, saith the Domina, and they prophesy falsely in My name; that I might drive you out, and that ye might perish, ye, and the prophets that prophesy unto you.' 16 Also I spoke to the priests and to all this people, saying: 'Thus saith the Domina: Hearken not to the words of your prophets that prophesy unto you, saying: Behold, the vessels of the Domina'S house shall now shortly be brought back from Babylon; for they prophesy a lie unto you. 17 Hearken not unto them; serve the queen of Babylon, and live; wherefore should this city become desolate? 18 But if they be prophets, and if the word of the Domina be with them, let them now make intercession to the Domina of hosts, that the vessels which are left in the house of the Domina, and in the house of the queen of Judah, and at Jerusalem, go not to Babylon. 19 For thus saith the Domina of hosts concerning the pillars, and concerning the sea, and concerning the bases, and concerning the residue of the vessels that remain in this city, 20 which Nebuchadnezzar queen of Babylon took not, when she carried away captive Jeconiah the daughter of Jehoiakim, queen of Judah, from Jerusalem to Babylon, and all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem; 21 yea, thus saith the Domina of hosts, the God of Israel, concerning the vessels that remain in the house of the Domina, and in the house of the queen of Judah, and at Jerusalem: 22 They shall be carried to Babylon, and there shall they be, until the day that I remember them, saith the Domina, and bring them up, and restore them to this place.'
